workflow.name: Classify YouTube videos & generate email summaries with GPT-4 and Gmail
workflow.description: # Classify YouTube Trends and Generate Email Summaries with GPT-4 and Gmail ![YouTube Trend Detector](https://img.shields.io/badge/Template-YouTube_Trend_Detector-blue?logo=n8n) ![YouTube](https://img.shields.io/badge/YouTube-FF0000?logo=youtube&logoColor=white) ![OpenAI](https://img.shields.io/badge/OpenAI-GPT--4-black?logo=openai) ![n8n](https://img.shields.io/badge/Workflow-n8n-12BEB4?logo=n8n&logoColor=white) ![Gmail](https://img.shields.io/badge/Email-Gmail_OAuth2-D14836?logo=gmail&logoColor=white) ![SMTP](https://img.shields.io/badge/Email-SMTP-6E6E6E) Monitor YouTube channels, fetch stats, classify videos as viral (‚â• 1000 likes) or normal, and auto‚Äëgenerate LinkedIn/email summaries with GPT‚Äë4. Deliver via Gmail or SMTP. Clear node names, examples, and auditable fields. --- ## üéØ Overview This template monitors YouTube channels via **RSS** or the **YouTube Data API**, retrieves video stats, classifies each video as **viral** (‚â• 1000 likes) or **normal**, and produces concise LinkedIn/email summaries with **OpenAI (GPT‚Äë4 family)**. It can send a compact weekly briefing via **Gmail (OAuth2)** or **SMTP**. Built for creators, marketing teams, and agencies who want automated trend alerts and ready‚Äëto‚Äëuse content. This screenshot shows the Gmail-ready weekly briefing generated by the **Generate Weekly Briefing (HTML)** node in my YouTube Trend Detector workflow, confirming the end-to-end pipeline: RSS/API ‚Üí stats ‚Üí like-based classification (‚â• 1000 = viral) ‚Üí LLM summaries ‚Üí HTML email. --- ## üß≠ How It Works (Node Map) 1. **Manual Run** ‚Äì ad‚Äëhoc execution 2. **Set Channel IDs** ‚Äì provide one or more YouTube `channelId` values 3. **Split Channels** ‚Äì process channels one by one 4. **Fetch Latest Videos (RSS)** ‚Äì pull recent uploads via channel RSS 5. **Filter: Published in Last 72h** ‚Äì only recent items are kept 6. **Get Video Stats (YouTube API)** ‚Äì request `snippet,statistics` for likes and details 7. **Classify by Likes (Code)** ‚Äì sets `classification` to `viral` or `normal` 8. **Branch: Normal / Branch: Viral** ‚Äì separate LLM prompts per relevance 9. **Write Post (Normal / Viral)** ‚Äì generate LinkedIn‚Äëstyle notes via OpenAI 10. **Aggregate Posts for Briefing** ‚Äì merge all texts into one block 11. **Generate Weekly Briefing (HTML)** ‚Äì produce a Gmail‚Äërobust HTML email via GPT 12. **Send Weekly Briefing (Gmail/SMTP)** ‚Äì deliver briefing (you set recipients) --- ## ‚öôÔ∏è Quick Start (‚âà 3 minutes) 1. **Import** the sanitized JSON into n8n (Menu ‚Üí Import). 2. **Create credentials** (use exact names): - `YouTube_API_Key` ‚Äî Generic credential (field: `apiKey`) - `OpenAi account` ‚Äî OpenAI API Key - `Gmail account` (OAuth2) **or** `SMTP_Default` (SMTP) 3. **Configure channels:** In **Set Channel IDs**, list your YouTube `channelId` values (e.g., `UC‚Ä¶`). 4. **Set recipients:** In **Send Weekly Briefing**, add your target email(s). 5. **Test:** Run **Execute Workflow** and review outputs from the LLM and send nodes. --- ## üîë Required Credentials - **YouTube_API_Key** ‚Äî YouTube Data API v3 key (field `apiKey`) - **OpenAi account** ‚Äî OpenAI API key for LLM nodes - **Gmail account** (OAuth2, recommended) **or** **SMTP_Default** (server/port/TLS + app password if 2FA) --- ## üß© Key Parameters & Adjustments - **Viral threshold:** In `Classify by Likes (Code)` ‚Üí `const THRESHOLD = 1000;` - **YouTube API parts:** Use `part=snippet,statistics` to obtain `likeCount` - **Time window:** The filter keeps videos from the **last 72 hours** --- ## üß™ Troubleshooting - **Missing `likeCount` / `classification = "unknown"`** ‚Üí ensure `part=statistics` and a valid API key credential. - **Gmail OAuth `redirect_mismatch` / `access_denied`** ‚Üí redirect must be `https://<your-n8n-host>/rest/oauth2-credential/callback` and test users added if restricted. - **SMTP auth issues** ‚Üí set correct server/port/TLS and use an app password when 2FA is enabled. - **Empty LLM output** ‚Üí verify OpenAI key/quota and inspect node logs. --- ## üßæ Example Outputs **1) Classification (single video)** ```json { "videoId": "abc123XYZ", "title": "How to Ship an n8n Workflow with OpenAI", "likeCount": 1587, "classification": "viral", "needsStatsFetch": false } ``` **2) LinkedIn draft (viral)** ``` Did you know how much faster prompt workflows get with structured inputs? ‚Ä¢ Setup: n8n + YouTube API + OpenAI for auto-briefs ‚Ä¢ Tip: include `part=statistics` for reliable like counts Useful for teams tracking trending how-to content. What‚Äôs your best ‚Äúviral‚Äù signal besides likes? #n8n #YouTubeAPI #OpenAI #Automation #Growth ``` **3) Plain‚Äëtext email preview** ``` Subject: Weekly AI Briefing ‚Äî YouTube Trend Highlights Hi team, Highlights from our tracked channels: ‚Ä¢ Viral: ‚ÄúHow to Ship an n8n Workflow with OpenAI‚Äù (1.6k likes) ‚Ä¢ Normal: ‚ÄúRSS vs API: What‚Äôs Best for Monitoring?‚Äù Generated via n8n + GPT‚Äë4. ``` --- ## ‚úÖ Submission Checklist (meets the guidelines) - **Title clarity:** Mentions **GPT‚Äë4** and **Gmail** - **Language:** Entire document in **English** - **Node naming:** Descriptive, non‚Äëgeneric labels - **HTML ‚Üí Markdown:** No HTML in this description; badges are **Markdown images** - **Examples:** Included (JSON, LinkedIn draft, email) - **Security:** No secrets in JSON; uses credentials by name --- ## üì∏ Suggested Screenshots (optional) 1. Full canvas overview (entire workflow) 2. LLM output (expanded) showing generated summary 3. Send‚Äënode result with messageId/status 4. Optional: aggregated briefing preview --- ## üìú License & Support **License:** MIT **Support/Contact:** kaihoelters@yahoo.de

parameters.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Provide the YouTube Channel IDs in the Set node (field: ChannelID). After changes, run a manual test (Execute).
üîê IMPORTANT: Do not hardcode API keys. Use the credential named "YouTube_API_Key" (field: apiKey).
üìä Classification: Videos with >= 1000 likes = "viral". Adjust by changing constant THRESHOLD in the classification Function node.
ü§ñ OpenAI: Ensure credential "OpenAi account" exists. You can tweak tone/length of the prompts for LinkedIn/email.
‚úâÔ∏è Email delivery: Use Gmail OAuth (credential: "Gmail account") or any SMTP (credential: "SMTP_Default"). Always send a test first!

values.content: You are a social media strategist. Your job is to turn technical news into concise, professional LinkedIn posts. Style: clear, analytical, discussion-oriented. Output only the final post text.

=TASK: Create an informative LinkedIn post about the video below.

VIDEO TITLE:
{{ $json.title }}

CLASSIFICATION:
{{ $json.classification }}

VIDEO SUMMARY (from description):
"""
{{ $json.original.snippet.description }}
"""

INSTRUCTIONS:
1) Start with a question that captures the core topic (e.g., "Did you know how‚Ä¶?").
2) Extract the 2‚Äì3 most important facts as bullet points.
3) Explain who benefits (1‚Äì2 sentences).
4) Invite discussion with a closing question.
5) Add 4‚Äì5 specific hashtags.
You are a social media strategist. Your job is to turn technical news into concise, professional LinkedIn posts. Style: clear, analytical, discussion-oriented. Output only the final post text.

=TASK: Create a LinkedIn post using the precise data below.

VIDEO TITLE:
{{ $json.title }}

RELEVANCE:
{{ $json.classification }}

VIDEO SUMMARY (from description):
"""
{{ $json.original.snippet.description }}
"""

INSTRUCTIONS:
1) Strong hook question referencing title and relevance.
2) 3 key takeaways as bullets.
3) Short professional angle (1‚Äì2 sentences) for engineers.
4) Open question as CTA.
5) 4‚Äì5 relevant hashtags.

=You act as Head of Intelligence for system integrators & AI engineers. Goal: a weekly, lossless, compact email briefing as valid HTML (Gmail-robust); no raw-dump.

Non-negotiables: No loss, signal over noise, zero hallucination, strict HTML output. Include audit: entity index, evidence snippets (‚â§160 chars), SHA-256 input hash. 600px centered table layout, system fonts, no external assets. Exactly one <h1>, 4‚Äì5 deep dives, strategy section, coverage log. Output must start with <!DOCTYPE html>.

=Create the internal "AI News Weekly Briefing" as a single Gmail-robust HTML document from the raw text below. RAW INPUT """ {{ $json.weekly_summary_input }} """ LANGUAGE: English (EN) STRUCTURE:

lead trend;

intro

; 4‚Äì5

deep dives (90‚Äì140 words, ‚â•2 bolded terms from input);
;

Strategic Outlook

;

Coverage Log

with input hash, entity index, and 2-column evidence table. Gate: If output does not begin with , regenerate until valid.

parameters.content:
Title: Setup ‚Äî Your YouTube Channels
Enter the Channel IDs (UC‚Ä¶) you want to monitor in the Set node. You can copy the ID from the channel URL or the About section.

Title: API-Key Configuration
Ensure a valid YouTube Data API v3 credential exists. The request uses part=snippet,statistics to retrieve both title/description and likes. Classification fails without statistics.

Title: Logic ‚Äî What counts as "viral"?
Routing is based on the classification from the previous step. Threshold currently at 1000 likes (see Classify by Likes). Separate prompts emphasize urgency (viral) vs. information (normal).

user.name: Kai H√∂lters
user.bio: Als technischer Automatisierer konzipiere und implementiere ich skalierbare Workflows und Integrationen ‚Äî von n8n-Pipelines √ºber containerisierte Deployments (Docker/Compose) bis zu Monitoring und Observability (Prometheus/Grafana). Ich fokussiere auf Auditierbarkeit, Retry-Strategien und sichere Netzwerkkonfigurationen (IPv4/IPv6). OpenAI nutze ich f√ºr Zusammenfassungen, Trend-Erkennung und RAG; Demos & Workflow-JSONs sind auf GitHub dokumentiert.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
